content: Salary Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 10 Sep 2019I want to ask for a significant salary bump from my next compay as a freelance, do I need to provide verification about my pay?I am working at a startup as a freelance. My company does not contribute CPF for me (and neither do I). My salary (2.1K) is given via cheque so I don't have any payslips.I am looking to change job soon and was wondering if I can ask my next company for higher pay at 2.8K since I don't have any verification/payslips/CPF contribution?1 answerAnswerBump0

Luke Ho, Kick-Ass Financial Services Consultant at Trillion Financial PlannersLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Sep 2019You absolutely should. Freelancers of a high professional operational level would typically have very specific forms that show that they've been paid so much for their work. You have to compile these, show dates and demonstrate that you're worth that much.
I think a better way to negotiate what is basically a 33% raise, is to really show how much value you've brought to the startup. Talk to your boss about how things have changed for the work you've done and you'll have a better negotiating position.0 comments0
